sentences.name: Narator
sentences.sentence: Not wanting to remember this stuff, Will walks away from the store.

sentences.name: Narator
sentences.sentence: But not long after walking away from the store, he sees a street painter. The street painter wasn’t some random street painter.

sentences.name: Narator
sentences.sentence: Usually, when Will and Anna walk back to their apartment, Anna would make the painter draw something really stupid.

sentences.name: Anna
sentences.sentence: Hey there, oh great painter of the century.

sentences.name: Painter
sentences.sentence: Sigh... What do you want this time...?

sentences.name: Narator-Participant
sentences.sentence: The painter lets out a small sigh, knowing this customer is probably going to ask him something random again

sentences.name: Anna
sentences.sentence: Draw me something!

sentences.name: Painter
sentences.sentence: Not again. . .

sentences.name: Will
sentences.sentence: Not again. . .

sentences.name: Anna
sentences.sentence: You see... we got this high quality garlic that is of . .

sentences.name: Narator-Participant
sentences.sentence: The painter interrupt without letting Anna finish her sentence

sentences.name: Painter
sentences.sentence: That’s just one painfully average garlic, what are you on ab--

sentences.name: Narator
sentences.sentence: Anna intterupts the painter back

sentences.name: Anna
sentences.sentence: It's a HIGH QUAlity garlic. Now draw it.

sentences.name: Painter
sentences.sentence: Sigh. . . I’d rather draw you lovebirds than those random request, for the same price of course.

sentences.name: Will
sentences.sentence: It better be a good drawing or I'm not paying

sentences.name: Narator-Participant
sentences.sentence: The painter starts to draw the lovebirds. After a while the painter’s done with his work.

sentences.name: Painter
sentences.sentence: I’m done. What do you think? I draw this with your chemistry and personality in mind.

sentences.name: Narator-Participant
sentences.sentence: The couple is a frequent customer of the painter, so he has a feel of their personality from all those random request that he have gotten in the past

sentences.name: Will
sentences.sentence: This is. . . just one painfully average painting of us. . . Anna, what do you think?

sentences.name: Narator-Participant
sentences.sentence: Will glances at Anna, but Anna doesn't say anything. She just hug her big grocery bag. And smiles.

sentences.name: Narator-Participant
sentences.sentence: It doesn’t have to be a masterfully made painting or a professionally taken photo. It’s their picture.

sentences.name: Narator-Participant
sentences.sentence: And at that point, it’s already perfect. At least, that’s what Will thought when he saw her smile.
